item.title: DB indexì˜ ì •ì˜
item.description: What is index? USAGE 1 : Support for fast Lookup An index is any data structure that improves the performance of lookup. There are many different data structures used for this purpose. There are complex design trade-offs involving lookup performance, index size, and index-update performance. Many index designs exhibit logarithmic (O(log(N)) lookup performance and in some applications it is possible to achieve flat (O(1)) performance. USAGE 2 : Policing the database constraints (I assumed it as a DB table guideline)
